head.title: Retiring Debt Clock Could Be Put to New Use

hedline.hl1: Retiring Debt Clock Could Be Put to New Use

abstract.p: Larry Penner letter on May 14 article suggests Times Square's 'Debt Clock' should be used to keep track of New York City's and New York State's longterm financial borrowing (S)

block.p: Your article ''Debt Clock, Calculating Since '89, Is Retiring Before the Debt Does'' (May 14) was sad news. Strong economic growth during the 90's provided excess tax revenue that the federal government has begun to use in making a down payment toward paying off our national debt. When economic recession inevitably returns, watch how debt reduction resumes its position on the back burner of political priorities.
The debt clock has been a beacon to remind us of the terrible inheritance that could destroy the financial security of future generations.
